alert.note: Alert for Southern High Plains; Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 7:06PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Lewis and Clark and southwestern Teton Counties through 730 PM MDT... At 706 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 26 miles west of Augusta, or 44 miles southwest of Choteau, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, half inch hail and localized heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Lewis and Clark and southwestern Teton Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Southern High Plains; Southern Rocky Mountain Front
